pullrequest.title: [gazebo11] convert all boost::any to std::any to match sdf8

content.raw:
I just had a discussion with @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} about the migration implications of this `boost::any` -> `std::any` change, and they are significant. The `citadel_deps_msgs` branch compiles without these changes, but there are several `boost::bad_any_cast` failures that occur at runtime. Basically, these changes would require downstream users to modify their code to use `std::any` instead of `boost::any`, and they would have to notice the migration guide, as there wouldn't be a way to deprecate with compilation warnings.

There's currently only two places in PresetManager.cc that call the sdformat `Param::GetAny` function, so it's possible that these changes could be scoped more narrowly (`Joint.hh` and derived class actually don't need to change for example). I'm going to look into simplifying this change, since it currently would cause a significant migration burden to our users (such as `gazebo_ros_pkgs`).
